caption:
This photograph presents an aerial view of a lush, rural landscape. The image captures a blend of agricultural fields, forested areas, and scattered buildings creating a picturesque countryside setting.

Starting from the foreground, dense, dark green forests dominate the area, providing a rich texture that highlights the diversity of the tree types. Moving upward, the landscape opens up into cleared fields which are possibly used for agriculture, as indicated by their organized and flattened appearance. Some of these fields are segmented by what appear to be dirt roads or pathways that weave through the terrain, facilitating access throughout the area.

Scattered throughout the clearing are several buildings, most likely residential or farm-related structures. They vary in size and shape, some appearing as small, single-story homes, while others look like barns or storage sheds. A network of roads connects these buildings, suggesting a small community or a collective of farms. The presence of vehicles, visible as tiny specs near some of the buildings, implies human activity and habitation in this serene locale.

Towards the upper half of the image, the terrain transitions back to a mix of sporadically placed trees and open fields, showcasing different patchworks of land use. This region shows further signs of agriculture, possibly including different crop types, indicated by variations in the greenery's shading and the fields' configuration.

Overall, this image captures the tranquil interaction between human development and natural landscape, illustrating a serene, rural environment with ample forest coverage and agricultural activity. The photograph offers an expansive view of this harmonious setting under a soft, diffuse light, adding an almost dreamlike quality to the scene.
title: Aerial view of the Central Valley quadrangle which is bounded by Tracyton, Illahee, Brownsville and Silverdale. These communities and others in the area will be affected by population growth when the Navy's proposed Trident submarine base is built nearby.
